result.execSummary:
The defendant Rodney J. Sparks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DE must submit an apology to juvenile or juveniles family in way and manner to be determined by probation agent.  
Defendant may not have contact with C.A.N.-H., unless written consent is filed with the Clerk's office or outside business hours with the Price County Sheriff's Dept.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rodney J. Sparks

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
10:02 am - DA calls case and states appearances and agreement reached.  Defendant Rodney J. Sparks appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions DE regarding right to atty.    DE waives right to attorney.    Court orders amendment of charge to misd battery contrary to 940-19(1), a class A misd.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to amend counts.  Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  DA certifies victims rights compliance.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC.  DE to submit DNA sample at PRSO.  Court imposes:

Sentence withheld - 1 year probation
Conditions of probation
$243 court costs
$200 DNAAS
$45 SBDA 
DE must submit an apology to juvenile or juveniles family in way and manner to be determined by probation agent.
Defendant may not have contact with C.A.N.-H., unless written consent is filed with the Clerk's office or outside business hours with the Price County Sheriff's Dept.

Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 24, 2016 at 10:00 am.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.  Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  Defendant may not have contact with C.A.N.-H, dob 2/13/10, unless written consent is filed with the Clerk's office or outside business hours with the Price County Sheriff's Dept.

Defendant Rodney J. Sparks appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE waives right to attorney.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  Notice of right to attorney given to DE.
(denied request for court appointed atty.); Petition for appointment of atty., affidavit of indigency
State's Demand for Discovery & Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence
